pull.title: Slight cleanup of signet commitment description
pull.body: "either" and "Signet scriptSig header" seem to make no sense here, if other touchups are disagreeable I can drop them.

events.body: I think the `either` refers to the fact that one of (scriptSig, scriptWitness) can be empty, but not both.

Could mention the BIP number in the pull subject line?

Also, cc @kallewoof

ACK. Thanks for making that more understandable!

Ping @luke-jr.

events.message: Slight cleanup of signet commitment description

events.body: ACK, please merge at your convenience, @luke-jr.
Better with or without my suggested change

verification.payload:
tree f81464a30d2037dd64bd42d3949f3bf315448825
parent c8b47a8d48914254a17c43a16872362e46785019
author Gregory Sanders <gsanders87@gmail.com> 1599658715 -0400
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1599658715 -0400

bip141 commitment is required for signet blocks

Co-authored-by: MarcoFalke <falkemarco@gmail.com>

events.message:
bip141 commitment is required for signet blocks

Co-authored-by: MarcoFalke <falkemarco@gmail.com>

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -26,10 +26,10 @@ A new type of test network would be more suitable for integration testing by org
 
 A new type of network ("signet"), which takes an additional consensus parameter called the challenge (scriptPubKey). The challenge can be a simple pubkey (P2PKH style), or a k-of-n multisig, or any other script you would want.
 
-The witness commitment of the coinbase transaction is extended to include a secondary commitment (the signature/solution) of either:
+The witness commitment scriptPubKey of the coinbase transaction is extended to include an additional commitment in the optional data portion of the signature/solution for the block:
comments.body:
I think it could make sense to clarify that this is the BIP 141 commitment, and not some other random witness commitment. Also, it could mention that the BIP 141 commitment is required. So I suggest the following replacement

```suggestion
Signet requires all blocks to have a BIP 141 commitment in the coinbase transaction. The BIP 141 commitment's optional data must include an additional commitment of the signature/solution for the block:
```

@@ -26,10 +26,10 @@ A new type of test network would be more suitable for integration testing by org
 
 A new type of network ("signet"), which takes an additional consensus parameter called the challenge (scriptPubKey). The challenge can be a simple pubkey (P2PKH style), or a k-of-n multisig, or any other script you would want.
 
-The witness commitment of the coinbase transaction is extended to include a secondary commitment (the signature/solution) of either:

comments.body: great idea, adding more hooks into bip141 makes this section clearer

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -26,10 +26,10 @@ A new type of test network would be more suitable for integration testing by org
 
 A new type of network ("signet"), which takes an additional consensus parameter called the challenge (scriptPubKey). The challenge can be a simple pubkey (P2PKH style), or a k-of-n multisig, or any other script you would want.
 
-The witness commitment of the coinbase transaction is extended to include a secondary commitment (the signature/solution) of either:
+Signet requires all blocks to have a BIP 141 commitment in the coinbase transaction. The BIP 141 commitment's optional data must include an additional commitment of the signature/solution for the block:
comments.body: This seems like it contradicts the text from #983: "There is one other acceptable special case: if a block's challenge is e.g. `OP_TRUE` (`0x51`), where an empty solution would result in success, the block is also considered valid if the signet commitment is absent"

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -26,10 +26,10 @@ A new type of test network would be more suitable for integration testing by org
 
 A new type of network ("signet"), which takes an additional consensus parameter called the challenge (scriptPubKey). The challenge can be a simple pubkey (P2PKH style), or a k-of-n multisig, or any other script you would want.
 
-The witness commitment of the coinbase transaction is extended to include a secondary commitment (the signature/solution) of either:
+Signet requires all blocks to have a BIP 141 commitment in the coinbase transaction. The BIP 141 commitment's optional data must include an additional commitment of the signature/solution for the block:
 
     1-4 bytes - Push the following (4 + x + y) bytes
comments.body: I believe this should be 1-5 bytes (1 byte if 4+x+y <= 75, 2 bytes for PUSHDATA1 if 4+x+y < 256, 3 bytes for PUSHDATA2 if 4+x+y < 65536, and 5 bytes for PUSHDATA4).

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -26,10 +26,10 @@ A new type of test network would be more suitable for integration testing by org
 
 A new type of network ("signet"), which takes an additional consensus parameter called the challenge (scriptPubKey). The challenge can be a simple pubkey (P2PKH style), or a k-of-n multisig, or any other script you would want.
 
-The witness commitment of the coinbase transaction is extended to include a secondary commitment (the signature/solution) of either:
+Signet requires all blocks to have a BIP 141 commitment in the coinbase transaction. The BIP 141 commitment's optional data must include an additional commitment of the signature/solution for the block:
comments.body: Yeah, good point. @instagibbs there is an exception now for the case where if the challenge is enough to satisfy (e.g. `OP_TRUE`); in this case, the signet commitment may be omitted entirely.

     1-4 bytes - Push the following (4 + x + y) bytes

@@ -26,10 +26,10 @@ A new type of test network would be more suitable for integration testing by org
 
 A new type of network ("signet"), which takes an additional consensus parameter called the challenge (scriptPubKey). The challenge can be a simple pubkey (P2PKH style), or a k-of-n multisig, or any other script you would want.
 
-The witness commitment of the coinbase transaction is extended to include a secondary commitment (the signature/solution) of either:
+Signet requires all blocks to have a BIP 141 commitment in the coinbase transaction. The BIP 141 commitment's optional data must include an additional commitment of the signature/solution for the block:
comments.body: In which case the BIP 141 commitment isn't required either

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -26,10 +26,10 @@ A new type of test network would be more suitable for integration testing by org
 
 A new type of network ("signet"), which takes an additional consensus parameter called the challenge (scriptPubKey). The challenge can be a simple pubkey (P2PKH style), or a k-of-n multisig, or any other script you would want.
 
-The witness commitment of the coinbase transaction is extended to include a secondary commitment (the signature/solution) of either:
+Signet requires all blocks to have a BIP 141 commitment in the coinbase transaction. The BIP 141 commitment's optional data must include an additional commitment of the signature/solution for the block:
comments.body:
How about:

> Signet requires all blocks to have a BIP 141 commitment in the coinbase transaction. **In order to provide a solution to the block challenge,** the BIP 141 commitment's optional data must include an additional commitment of the solution for the block: [...]. **In the special case where an empty solution is valid (ie scriptSig and scriptWitness are both empty) this additional commitment can optionally be left out. This special case is to allow non-signet-aware block generation code to be used to test a custom signet chain where the challenge is `OP_TRUE`.**

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -26,10 +26,10 @@ A new type of test network would be more suitable for integration testing by org
 
 A new type of network ("signet"), which takes an additional consensus parameter called the challenge (scriptPubKey). The challenge can be a simple pubkey (P2PKH style), or a k-of-n multisig, or any other script you would want.
 
-The witness commitment of the coinbase transaction is extended to include a secondary commitment (the signature/solution) of either:
+Signet requires all blocks to have a BIP 141 commitment in the coinbase transaction. The BIP 141 commitment's optional data must include an additional commitment of the signature/solution for the block:
comments.body: Took a modified version of what you posted, noting that bip141 commitment is only required with non-empty solutions, and that any "trivial" challenge can be used to avoid requiring fancy mining software for non-signature tests.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -26,10 +26,10 @@ A new type of test network would be more suitable for integration testing by org
 
 A new type of network ("signet"), which takes an additional consensus parameter called the challenge (scriptPubKey). The challenge can be a simple pubkey (P2PKH style), or a k-of-n multisig, or any other script you would want.
 
-The witness commitment of the coinbase transaction is extended to include a secondary commitment (the signature/solution) of either:
+Signet requires all blocks to have a BIP 141 commitment in the coinbase transaction. The BIP 141 commitment's optional data must include an additional commitment of the signature/solution for the block:
comments.body: I believe the current code requires a bip141 commitment even with empty solutions. Should this be changed?

@@ -26,10 +26,10 @@ A new type of test network would be more suitable for integration testing by org
 
 A new type of network ("signet"), which takes an additional consensus parameter called the challenge (scriptPubKey). The challenge can be a simple pubkey (P2PKH style), or a k-of-n multisig, or any other script you would want.

comments.body:
you are correct: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/18267/commits/d0f364c2ddf6b7e7a1d89af18c60de8248ce5ff3#diff-4bdd7c44636dae0429a4d61909eeed17R90

I think for simplicity it's fine to require it. Any objections?

@@ -26,13 +26,15 @@ A new type of test network would be more suitable for integration testing by org
 
 A new type of network ("signet"), which takes an additional consensus parameter called the challenge (scriptPubKey). The challenge can be a simple pubkey (P2PKH style), or a k-of-n multisig, or any other script you would want.

comments.body:
```suggestion
Signet requires all blocks to have a BIP 141 commitment in the coinbase transaction. In order to provide a non-empty solution to the block challenge the block's BIP 141 commitment's optional data must include an additional commitment of the signature/solution for the block:
```

Could keep this for clarification?
